comment.author: 78249091@N05
comment._content:
This entry  "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Inflexible_(1907)#Dardanelles_Campaign" has an outline of the naval engagement during which lead to the death of this naval officer.

Commonwealth War Graves Commission has following details

BLAKER, ARTHUR WILFRID
Rank:Lieutenant
Date of Death:19/03/1915 Age:26
Regiment/Service:Royal Navy   H.M.S. "Inflexible." 
Awards:Mentioned in Despatches
Memorial CHATHAM NAVAL MEMORIAL Panel Reference 8
Additional Information:
Son of Arthur Beckett Blaker and Elizabeth J. Blaker, of The Lodge, Portslade, Sussex.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Arthur Wilfrid Blaker registered 2nd quarter 1889  Lewes Sussex 2b185 (FreeBMD)

There is a book
Author: Walter Charles Renshaw
Title: Searches into the History of the Family of Blaker of Sussex
Publication: Chiswick Press, London 1894
which gives date of birth of Arthur Wilfrid Blaker as 27 March 1889

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Family members commemorated in Blaker vault St Nicholas Church Portslade www.geocities.ws/chris3357/blaker/memorials-2.html The Blakers have a 400-year association with the Parish. Arthur Blaker acquired the 18th century Manor Lodge in 1908. It was situated opposite the village green. portslade-cofe.blogspot.ca/p/portslade-old-village-histor...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: His Blaker ancestors reach back to the 17th century in this tree familytreemaker.genealogy.com/users/b/a/c/Suzanne-Backhou... and his siblings are Dorothy Kathleen b. 1888, Brenda Mary b. 1891 and Geoffrey Beckett b. 1895.
